author: Animalogic
description:
These horror parasites take over a snail's braaaaaiinns and turn them into a billoard saying, "I'm delicious, eat me!" It's a convoluted way for the parasite to get to its ultimate location: the guts of a bird. This is the sci-fi life of the green-banded broodsac worm. 

Get your copy of "Strange Creatures" now! It’s filled with all the amazing animal facts and beautiful original illustrations that you’ve come to love from us. 📗🐾 Order here: http://bit.ly/animalogicbook

title: These Worms Turn Snails Into Disco Zombies! #animals #parasites #shorts

author: Animalogic
description:
The silent bear of the Andes, the spectacled bear is a monk-like giant of the hills. It has an ethereal aura, which has made it the inspiration for the cartoonishly friendly Paddington Bear. But despite it's ghostly presence, it's a real survivor who has adapted to life in one Earth's most unique ecosysystems: the paramo. Can our team find this elusive bear? Or will it just disappear like a mountain ghost?

Subscribe to Sebastian's Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/@UClVaR77bkqz6Fj4ezQhs4Vw 
and follow him on Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/sebastiandido/?hl=en

Support Fundación Oso Andino:
https://osoandino.org/

For more pics of Andean bears and other animals of the páramo, follow Arley Muñoz at https://www.instagram.com/arleysar/

00:00 We Found South America's Last Bear Species
01:25 What is an Andean Bear? (Quick species intro)
02:08 Polar bears vs. ancient short-faced bears
03:04 The real-life inspiration for Paddington Bear
04:38 Journey to Chingaza Lagoon – prim
title: We Found South America's Last Bear Species
